description: Borrowed from Latin dispēnsātōrius, and the noun dispēnsātōrium. Compare Latin dispēnsātor, dispēnsō and English dispense.

adjectives.description: dispensatory (comparative more dispensatory, superlative most dispensatory)

entries.meaning: Granting, or authorized to grant, dispensations.
examples: The dispenser [is] the Son of man; the author of his dispensatory power, God the Father.

entries.meaning: (pharmacy, pharmacology) A book containing a systematic description of drugs and of preparations made from them.
